label: Fail to extract the right entities
rationale: The model based its prediction on an extracted release year for 'fio' (2005/2006) from sources like GitHub, while the gold answer cites a 2010 date for the Flexible I/O Tester. This indicates the model selected or extracted the wrong entity/date for the key item (fio), leading to an underestimated year.

label: Gold answer is wrong
rationale: The model correctly used Twitter's launch year (2006) as the entity date; the gold row uses 2008 (from the cited furbo.org page), which appears incorrect. The prediction is earlier because the gold answer's year is wrong rather than the model failing to extract or search correctly.

label: Fail to extract the right entities
rationale: The model dated individual cited papers (e.g., Kheifets 2014, Li 2010) instead of the literature review itself. It misidentified which entity to timestamp — extracting years for the cited works rather than the review (the provided gold entity: the 2018 MDPI review) — so the wrong entity was used to produce the predicted year.
